body.name: RIOWOIS Passive Bookshelf Speakers for Home Theater Surround Sound, Home Desktop Stereo Speakers with Crisper Sound and Classic Wood Grain for Record Player/Computer/TV, Wall Mountable, One Pair.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 47 mins
features: 【Compact Design, Bold Performance】Despite their compact size of 4.3" in length and 6.6" in height, RIOWOIS passive bookshelf speakers can deliver a peak power of up to 30W. With a 6-ohm impedance, these bookshelf speakers are compatible with a wide range of amplifiers and can handle dynamic peaks without distortion.

【2.75-inch Woofer and 2-inch Tweeter】Experience clear and balanced sound with our passive bookshelf speaker, which features a 2.75-inch woofer and a 2-inch tweeter. The independent tweeter and woofer work together to deliver more accurate and complete sound than a single full-range driver.

【3D Wood Grain Appearance】The natural beauty of wood grain adds a touch of elegance and warmth to the bookshelf speakers, making them visually appealing and blending well with various room decor styles. This particular wood grain is not only beautiful but also gives the user wonderful tactile feedback. Gliding across the delicately textured surface provides a tactile sensation that is pleasing and inviting.

【Wide Range of Applications】The package contains all the accessories needed for wall mounting. With the hooks and shockproof tab on the back of the bookshelf speakers, you can easily hang the speakers in every corner of your room.

【Three-year Warranty】Get peace of mind with our package that includes passive bookshelf speakers, wall-mounted accessories, and a generous three-year product warranty. Our dedicated after-sales team is available 24/7 to provide exceptional service and support for your products. Order now and enjoy worry-free listening!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: RIOWOIS Passive Bookshelf Speakers for Record Player "Dynamic Wood Grain Appearance: Transforms with Changing Light" RIOWOIS bookshelf speakers boast a sturdy MDF build and a distinctive wood grain finish that brings an air of elegance and sophistication to any space. Moreover, this special wood grain's appearance transforms with varying lighting and angles, creating a visually captivating effect. "Special 3D Wood Grain Appearance: 3D Touch Experience" When you run your fingers over the wood grain, you can feel the ridges and grooves of the texture, which can be a satisfying sensory experience. The wood grain finish also help to reduce fingerprints and smudges on the bookshelf speaker's surface, as the texture helps to hide any marks or blemishes.

"Compact But Powerful" Speaker Dimensions: 6.6*4.7*4.3 inchRIOWOI passive bookshelf speakers enhances audio with 2-inch tweeter and 2.75-inch woofer for fuller sound, clearer dialogue, and deeper bass—all in a compact!Please note that the speaker wire is not included, and the passive speakers require an amplifier or receiver to function properly.

Super Size Rounded Corners by Manual Polishing The four rounded corners on the bookshelf speakers make a bold visual statement, drawing attention to the bookshelf speaker and making it a focal point in any room. Beyond their aesthetic appeal, the rounded corners also serve a practical purpose by reducing diffraction and sound distortion.The angled edges break up sound waves, resulting in a clearer and more accurate sound. Moreover, the rounded corners enhance the speaker's durability by protecting it from bumps and reducing the risk of scratches or dents.

Wall Mount in Minutes In addition to the pair of passive speakers, the package includes all the necessary wall mounting accessories(Screws, wall anchors) including a wall mounting bracket that comes with the speakers, as well as anti-vibration cushions.

Enjoy Your Favorite Music Due to their space-saving advantages, the RIOWOIS passive bookshelf speakers are an ideal choice for desktop computer setups. Simply pair them with an amplifier, and you'll have your very own two-channel desktop audio system.Please note that the speaker wire and remote is not included, and the passive speakers require an amplifier or receiver to function properly.

Specifications of Bookshelf Speakers Impedance: 6 ohms Rated Power: 5~20W Maxium Input Power: 30W(Peak Power) Sound Pressure Level: 75dB Frequency Response: 65Hz~20KHz Speaker Dimensions: 6.6*4.7*4.3 inch Please note the speaker wire is not included, and the passive speakers require an amplifier or receiver to function properly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great highs and mids
reviews.reviewText: I needed some crispness. I use these with a subwoofer on an older Onkyo receiver and they sound great. Can't be beat for 28 bucks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars An audiophile's review of $35.00 a pair speakers
reviews.reviewText: I've been an advocate for high end audio equipment for many years. I want my audio systems to sound like real live music, not like something coming out of a small box. I saw these speakers on Amazon and wanted to do an honest review on a set of speakers that sell for 35 bucks a pair. This review is based on those principles, but also considers the low price that these speakers sell for.First of all, these RIOWOIS Passive Bookshelf Speakers, are made of thick medium density fiberboard, they are heavier than they appear. Because they are, there are no cabinet vibrations or rattles while loud music is playing. Try that with a plastic cabinet set of small speakers and you'll hear the difference.In the setup to review these speakers I'm using a high quality integrated amplifier that is rated to deliver 50 watts per channel RMS, with both channels driven from 20 hz to 20Khz , with less than .03% THD, at 8 ohm. At the 6 ohm resistance of the speakers being tested, that power output rises to 70 watts per channel. The speakers handle that amplifier power nicely, no distorted crescendos. The music source is a logitech squeezebox touch playing from a 1200 CD music server ripped in lossless format.As I type this review, I'm listening to the speakers playing a recording of a live concert by a contemporary folk artist named David Wilcox. It sounds like real music, with stable imaging and good tonal balance. I'd post a video of the speakers playing so you could get some idea of the sound quality, but that would result in a copyright hit and the review would be rejected by the moderators.Now some reality. The speakers are advertised as having a frequency response of 65hz to 20 khz. There are no parameters listed for how that was measured. Luckily, I have a frequency generator that I hooked to the input, and used a sound meter to get some reality into those specs.They do not respond down to 65 hz at the standard plus or minus 3 db qualification that is required of honest measurements. They do respond at 65 hz, but the the output was down at least 6 db at that point. That is not a surprise because a 2.75 inch woofer just can't move enough air to produce an honest 65 hz response.Would I use these speakers to replace the main speakers you see behind these in the photos? Of course not. Are these speakers designed to listen to pipe organ music? Again, of course not. Where these would fill the purpose, is in a desktop system, for casual listening. Or, with your computer. They would also work well as surround speakers in an audio video setup. They are easily mounted on a wall.Within their price point, these speakers deserve a solid four stars from me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Speakers for the Size and Price!
reviews.reviewText: I am firm believer in reviewing items according to their price and features. Therefore I am not going to compare these speakers to $300 Polk speakers. That would not be fair. These Riowois speakers are well made, and sound pretty good! The appearance is great. The cabinet material, and the vinyl wrap look great. The grill is neatly made, and stays firmly in place on the front of the speaker. If you remove the grill, the exposed speakers look good too. They are mounted well, straight, and there is no excess glue or other things to spoil the appearance. These speakers are small. Very small.This was my signal chain for the testing: Windows 11 PC -- into a Focusrite audio interface -- into a Mackie 402VLZ4 mixer -- into a Fosi Audio TB10D power amp.The sound was better than expected for a speaker of this size, and especially for this ridiculously low price point. They lacked bass response of course. But the overall sound was as good as can be expected considering the cost. It was a little crunchy on the high end. But also well within expectations. I am sure these speakers would do well with an added subwoofer.Nice little speakers! Cheap, nice looking, and sound decent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid, compact, great sound, great value
reviews.reviewText: These speakers sound surprisingly good for their size and price. They are very solid and weigh a lot so you don't hear a lot of vibration from the enclosure.At only 30W, they're not going to be great as mains, but for surround, they are really nice. The audio sounds clear. There is good response on both highs and lows.My ears aren't what they used to be, but I still have a fairly good sense of something that sounds good. These sound good.They look good too. I have these in my living room, where I want things to look nice. The cabinets on these speakers look like real wood. In fact, I'd say they look just as nice as my $300 speakers that are made of wood.They're very compact, so they fit nicely pretty much anywhere. As bookshelf speakers go, these are great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Paired with a small generic desktop amp + DAC fed by motherboard's audio optical port, these little bookshelf style speakers outperform my little Creative ball-shaped 2.1 system. I'm not doing any super-loud listening. I just wanted more overall audio range and response for games, music, watching streams, etc.These are indeed a step up for me. I find them clearer than the average store-bought PC speakers, but the highs are a bit crispy (thankfully that can be EQ'd out with a tiny adjustment down from noon on a treble dial). Won't call them the greatest because I have put ears to many different brands and configurations before, but for the average fella who just wants something a little more for their gaming rig/occasional audio editing, these are a good direction to look for 36 bucks. If you still find yourself in need of bass response, definitely look into a small add'l sub (the speaker, not the other kind, you naughty thing!)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like the design of these Riowois speakers; they look good. The finish is a black faux woodgrain, and the speaker grills are detachable. They have some excellent wall-mount hardware on the back of the speakers. I know that sound quality is subjective; these speakers sound pretty average to me at best; at their worst, lows are muddy, and highs have no snap.
